key_risks: High financial leverage and significant debt burden
Volatility in advertising revenue due to economic fluctuations
Threat from cord-cutting and industry disruption
Regulatory risks from FCC rules and media ownership regulations
Concerns over Berkshire Hathaway's investment due to financial leverage
controversies: Significant debt increase post ION Media acquisition
Recent quarterly losses despite cost-cutting measures
Decline in local core advertising revenue
social_issues: Impact of industry disruption on local journalism and community-focused programming
governance_issues: Potential regulatory changes impacting operations and market position

sources.title: Scripps Reports Third Quarter 2024 Financial Results - Scripps
sources.snippet: The E.W. Scripps Company (NASDAQ: SSP) delivered a record $646 million in revenue for the third quarter of 2024, driven by record political advertising revenue. The company expects full-year political advertising revenue to reach at least $340 million, which, combined with determined expense management, is fueling significant debt and leverage reduction this year.

sources.title: E.W. Scripps Expands Affiliation Deal with NBC TV Stations
sources.snippet: E.W. Scripps said it has expanded an affiliation deal with NBC that covers 11 television stations across the country. sources.title: E. W. Scripps Company - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: The E. W. Scripps Company, also known as Scripps, is an American broadcasting company founded in 1878 as a chain of daily newspapers by Edward Willis "E. W." Scripps and his sister, Ellen Browning Scripps.It was also formerly a media conglomerate. The company is headquartered at the Scripps Center in Cincinnati, Ohio.
